intro: Ibidium spirale, commonly known as the spiral ibidium, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
